nouns.description: parashah (plural parashahs or parashiyot or parashot or parashoth or parashiot)

entries.meaning: (Judaism) A section of a book in the Hebrew text of the Tanakh, which may be open (a petuhah) or closed (a setumah).
(Judaism) One of 54 sections of the Torah read weekly by religious Jews, particularly in the synagogue on the morning of the Jewish Sabbath
